qas.question: Where in Houston is the world's largest grouping of healthcare institutions?
How many non profit organizations are members of the Medical Center?
How many people are employed in the Texas Medical Center?
How many hospitals belong to the Medical Center group of organizations?
What is the name of the first air emergency service?
Where in Texas is the world's largest grouping of healthcare institutions?
How many for-profit organizations are members of the Medical Center?
How many people are employed in the Houston Medical Center?
How many hospitals are outside of the Medical Center group of organizations?

context: Houston is the seat of the internationally renowned <a0_0><b5_0>Texas Medical Center<b5_0/><a0_0/>, which contains the world's largest concentration of research and healthcare institutions. All <a1_0><b6_0>49<b6_0/><a1_0/> member institutions of the Texas Medical Center are non-profit organizations. They provide patient and preventive care, research, education, and local, national, and international community well-being. Employing more than <a2_0><b7_0>73,600<b7_0/><a2_0/> people, institutions at the medical center include <a3_0><b8_0>13<b8_0/><a3_0/> hospitals and two specialty institutions, two medical schools, four nursing schools, and schools of dentistry, public health, pharmacy, and virtually all health-related careers. It is where one of the first—and still the largest—air emergency service, <a4_0>Life Flight<a4_0/>, was created, and a very successful inter-institutional transplant program was developed. More heart surgeries are performed at the Texas Medical Center than anywhere else in the world.
